Province: Nizhny Novgorod Oblast 
Country/Town/Village:  Zelyony Gorod

The Boarding House for War and Labor Veterans is a main destination for deported children and adults. In July 2022, some festive events were organised for the children and teenagers living in the camp, according to this [article](https://nnovgorod.sledcom.ru/news/item/1703850/).

Date of discovery: 21 February 2022
 Province: Kabardino-Balkarian 
Republic Oblast Country/Town/Village: Nalchik  

Kavkaz is one of five regional sanatoriums preparing to receive over 400 refugees from Donetsk and Luhansk.

Date of discovery: 21 February 2022 
Province: Oryol Oblast 
Country/Town/Village:  Streletskii 

Orlovchanka Sanatorium is one the TACs opened in the region to accommodate mostly children from Ukraine. In December 2022, the TAC's employees received an award from the Oryol region governor for receiving over 300 refugees from Donbass since February, according to this [article](https://ogtrk.ru/novosti/101185.html).

The location of this camp is better indexed by [Yandex](https://yandex.ru/maps/org/detskiy_ozdorovitelny_lager_ostashyovo/235314751754/?ll=35.815052%2C55.830050&z=15.93).

Date of discovery: 21 February 2022 
Province: Kabardino-Balkarian Republic 
Country/Town/Village: Nalchik  

Dolinsk is one of five regional sanatoriums preparing to receive over 400 refugees from Donetsk and Luhansk.

Date of discovery: February 22 2022 
Province: Moscow Oblast 
Country/Town/Village: Puskino district

In the Moscow region, one of the TACs for refugees is located in Puskino district and it is named  ["Rodnik"](https://rodnik-korolev.ru/opisanie-lagerya/).  In July 2022, a local singer [went](https://woman.rambler.ru/children/48923590-pavel-paskal-spel-dlya-detey-v-pushkinskom-lagere-rodnik/) to the camp to sing to over 100 children from Donetsk, Lugansk and Mariupol in the camp. The camp started to receive Ukrainians since  February 2022 ([link 1](https://www.tvc.ru/news/show/id/234005),[link 2](https://vk.com/wall-45873375_29699)).


According to [360tv.ru](https://360tv.ru/news/mosobl/podmoskove-uvelichilo-kolichestvo-punktov-vremennogo-razmeschenija-dlja-zhitelej-donbassa-i-belgoroda/), as of  end-2022, there were 12 TACs in the Moscow region receiving refugees from Donbass and Belgorod.

The location of this camp is better indexed by [Yandex](https://bit.ly/3jZPpZ4).

Date of discovery: 24 February 2022 
Province: Moscow Oblast 
Country/Town/Village: Kolomna, Nepetsino

In the Moscow region, one of the TACs for refugees is located in Kolomna, Nepetsino, and is called Meteor. More information about the how the camp was run in February 2022 [here](https://kolomna.bezformata.com/listnews/detskom-ozdorovitelnom-lagere/102848943/).

According to [360tv.ru](https://360tv.ru/news/mosobl/podmoskove-uvelichilo-kolichestvo-punktov-vremennogo-razmeschenija-dlja-zhitelej-donbassa-i-belgoroda/), as of  end-2022, there were 12 TACs in the Moscow region receiving refugees from Donbass and Belgorod.

The location of this camp is better indexed by [Yandex](https://yandex.com/maps/org/children_holiday_home_nepetsino/33306376004/?ll=38.585655%2C55.193131&z=17.4).

Zhuravushka is one of three TACs organised in the region.

In the Moscow region, one of the TACs is located in Zaraysk district, in "Sturion" (осетр) camp. 

According to [360tv.ru](https://360tv.ru/news/mosobl/podmoskove-uvelichilo-kolichestvo-punktov-vremennogo-razmeschenija-dlja-zhitelej-donbassa-i-belgoroda/), as of  end-2022, there were 12 TACs in the Moscow region receiving refugees from Donbass and Belgorod.

The Romashka camp received 250 children evacuated from Donbass in February 2022.

Date of discovery: 27 February 2022
 Province: Moscow Oblast  
Country/Town/Village: Volokolamsk

In the Moscow region, one of the TACs for refugees is located in Volokolamsk, near the Panfilov's 28 Men monument. As of 06 February 2023, 108 people lived in the camp, of which 43 were children.

More details on a visit from United Russia Party officials at the camp where 125 children lived as of February 27 2022 [here](https://moscow.er.ru/activity/news/senator-inna-svyatenko-privezla-gumanitarnuyu-pomosh-dlya-bezhencev-iz-dnr-i-lnr-razmeshennyh-v-volokolamske). 

The location of this camp is better indexed by [Yandex](https://yandex.com/profile/1090139579?no-distribution=1&source=wizbiz_new_map_single).

Date of discovery: 01 March 2022 
Province: Moscow Oblast 
Country/Town/Village: Podolsk,  Lukovnya Village 

In the Moscow region, one of the TACs for refugees is located in Podolsk, Lukovnya Village, and is named "Mechta" (Dream). Information about the arrival of the first convoy of buses from Donbass carrying children and women [here](https://360tv.ru/news/mosobl/bezhentsy-iz-donbassa-pribyli-v-podolsk-deti-v-lagere-uzhe-podruzhilis/). 

According to [360tv.ru](https://360tv.ru/news/mosobl/podmoskove-uvelichilo-kolichestvo-punktov-vremennogo-razmeschenija-dlja-zhitelej-donbassa-i-belgoroda/), as of  end-2022, there were 12 TACs in the Moscow region receiving refugees from Donbass and Belgorod.

The location of this camp is better indexed by [Yandex](https://bit.ly/3K9vHED).

Date of discovery: 17 March 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Manhush

Local residents obliged to pass "filtration" at former Manhush police station (63 Tytova Street - now used by Ministry of Internal Affairs of self-proclaimed DNR) or at nearby checkpoint in order to obtain right of free movement in the region; people could be held for 1-2 days in overcrowded cells and have described beatings and insufficient food.

Date of dicovery: 24 March 2022

Russia claims to have 'evacuated' 402,000 Ukrainians to Russia, including 84,000 children. This "evacuation" is being assessed as being a forcible transfer of people including children to Russia through harsh filtration camps. Source - Verkhovna Rada Commissioner for Human Rights Lyudmyla Denisova.

Date of discovery: 01 April 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast,
City/Town/Village: Katiuzhanka

Armed Forces of Ukraine liberated the entire Kyiv Oblast, including Katiuzhanka. The school was used as an HQ for the Russian military to command attacks towards Kyiv and  as a torture chamber by Russian interrogators for POWs and Ukrainian civilians.

In April 2022, Mechta Sanatorium along with Lesnaya Skazka and the Vega social and health centre received approximately 90 children from Ukraine.

Date of discovery: 05 April 2022 
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Dokuchayevsk

House of Culture and Leisure used as holding facility for Ukrainian civilians from Mariupol awaiting registration as part of the "filtration" process (which could take place in the same location). Witnesses describe overcrowded and unsanitary conditions.

Date of discovery : 07 April 2022
Province: Lunahsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Luhansk

Izvestiya reported that Ukrainian soldiers who had "voluntarily laid down arms" were being held in the SIZO [Detention Centre] in Luhansk. Ukrainian independent outlet slidstvo.info noted on 10 June that the site is being used to hold people who have not passed "filtration".

Date of discovery: 08 April 2022 
Province: Mordovia Oblast
 Country/Town/Village: Saransk  

 35 Mordovskaya Street centre is one of three TACs organised in the region.

Date of discovery: 08 April 2022 
Province: Mordovia Oblast 
Country/Town/Village: Kovylkinsky district  

22 Proletarskaya Street centre is one of three TACs organised in the region.

Date of discovery: 08 April 2022 
Province: Mordovia Oblast 
Country/Town/Village: Kovylkinsky district  

[GBSU SOSSZN RM Volgapinsky Boarding House of Mercy](https://spark-interfax.ru/mordoviya-respublika-kovylkinski-raion/gbu-volgapinski-dom-internat-miloserdiya-inn-1312090481-ogrn-1021300887211-6906d9ac9efa226ae0531b9aa8c04bb6) on 2 Lenina Street centre is one of three TACs organised in the region.

Date of discovery: 10 April 2022 
Province: Leningrad Oblast 
Country/Town/Village: Tsaritsyno

Lake Tsaritsyno Lake boarding house in the Tikhvin region is identified as a main destination for over 200 children from Mariupol.  [Ria Novosti](https://ria.ru/20220410/bezhentsy-1782756282.html) reports in April 2022 that over 600 refugees from Mariupol, a quarter of whom are children arrived by train in the region and will be taken to Tsaritsyno Lake boarding house. 

The location of the camp is described as being on the shore of the lake.

Date of Discovery: 11 April 2022
Country: Russia, Volgograd Oblast
City/Town/Village: Kirovets

240 Ukrainians believed to be held at a camp near Kirovets. Exact geolocation pending

Date of discovery: 11 April 2022
Country: Russia, Bryansk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Novozybkov

SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 2, Krasnaya ploshchad 9, Novozybkov

Date of discovery: 13 April 2022 
Province: Oryol Oblast 
Country/Town/Village:  Streletskii 

Veterok Sanatorium is one of the TACs opened in the region to accommodate mostly children as well as adults from Ukraine.

Date of discovery: 15 April 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Novoazovsk

Civilians held for filtration in School No. 1, 2, and/or 3 in Novoazovsk - unclear which (Coordinates available for No. 1). One witness reported being held for two days without food and that people who resisted detainment  were beaten.

Date of discovery: 16 April 2022
Country: Russia
City/Town/Village: Ulyanovsk

Housing survivors of the Mariupol siege include the Vanguard Patriotic Education Centre near Ivanovka in Ulyanovsk. The centre, has a focus on “military-patriotic work” and promoting a “commitment to serving ones Motherland”, opened at the site of a former orphanage in February 2022 as part of a national “education” project.

Date of discovery: 16 April 2022
Country: Russia
Province: Leningrad Oblast

Described by the Russian government as a TAP - Temporary accommodation centre, this facility is part of a wide 66 camp network that houses 530 Ukrainians including 120 children from Mariupol, part of which have also been taken to the remote Tsaritsyno Lake boarding camp complex in the Leningrad Oblast - a three-hour drive from St Petersburg.

Date of discovery: 16 April 2022
Country: Russia
City/Town/Village: Penza

Ukraine’s human rights ombudsman Lyudmyla Denisova has warned that more than 400 people, including 147 children, are in a fenced camp near the city of Penza, according to information she has received from concerned Russian citizens.
After the Second World War, the facility was used as a munitions dump for Soviet chemical bombs and since 2008, it was at the centre of the Russia’s programme to disarm its arsenal of nerve agents including VX and sarin.

Date of discovery: 22 April 2022
Country: Russia, Smolensk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Vyzama

Address: SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 2 - 9 Dmitrova Gora Street.

Date of discovery: 23 April 2022
Country: Russia, Rostov Oblast
City/Town/Village: Taganrog

Address: SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 2 - 175 Lenina Street, Taganrog.

Date of discovery: 24 April 2022
Province: Rostov Oblast
City/Town/Village: Kamensk-Shakhtinsky

Ukrainian soldiers held captive in general regime colony № 12 in the town of Kamensk-Shakhtinsky without converting the prison to a POW camp, in violation of the Convention on the Treatment of Prisoners of War and its Additional Protocols, adopted in 1977 and 2005.

Date of Discovery: 24 April 2022
Province: Rostov Oblast
City/Town/Village: Zverevo

Ukrainian soldiers held captive in general regime colony № 12 in the town of Kamensk-Shakhtinsky without converting the prison to a POW camp in violation of the Convention on the Treatment of Prisoners of War and its Additional Protocols, adopted in 1977 and 2005, according to Ukraine Ombudsman office.

Date of discovery: 24 April 2022
Country: Russia, Tula Oblast
City/Town/Village: Komsomolsky mikrorayon, Donskoy

IK [Correctional Colony] No. 1, Dimitrova proyezd 1, mikrorayon Komsomolsky, Donskoy - remand facilities within colony apparently emptied to make room for 100 POWs.

Date of discovery: 25 April 2022
City/Town/Village: Vovchansk

According to Ombudsman Denisova, Russian troops created an internment camp in a factory building.

Date of discovery: 26 April 2022
Country: Russia, Tver Oblast
City/Town/Village: Kashin

SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 2 on 31 Krasnaya Street - local Russian news site reported that detention centre had been closed so it could be used by the Russian Defence Ministry for prisoners of war. On 4 August, local Telegram channel Zakroy za mnoy Tver reported that the presence of c. 200 Ukrainian soldiers had been confirmed by multiple FSIN [Federal Prison Service] employees. Under Russian law, people may only be placed in a pre-trial detention centre if this has been ordered by a court.

Date of Discovery: 30 April 2022
Country: Russia
City/Town/Village: Kursk

Ukrainian men were taken to prison camps, then to "SIZO I", a prison in the Russian city of Kursk where it has been reported following a prisoner exchange that Ukrainians were dressed like prisoners, tortured, had their hair cut as well as forced to learn patriotic Russian songs and perform them for their supervisors.  Interrogations took place two or three times a day, after which the men were severely beaten and later forced to sign documents stating that they had been treated well. Reported by Ukrainian Ombudsman Lyudmyla Denisova

Date of discovery - 02 May 2022
Country: Russia, Volgograd Oblast
City/Town/Village: Kamyshin

The website publishes a letter from someone in the city, where the SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 2, is located, on 38 Rabochaya Street, Kamyshin.
"I live in Taganrog, SIZO-2 in Taganrog is also occupied by Ukrainian prisoners of war. I am attaching a photo. Near the pre-trial detention center now there are constantly similar cars (with a Z-swastika)," the resident writes.

Date of discovery: 04 May 2022 
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Kozatske, Novoazovsky District

Chelyuskinska School (1 Shkilna Street, Kozatske) used to hold men from Mariupol for periods from days to weeks. Witnesses describe beatings by guards and illness among detainees.

Date of discovery: 07 May 2022
Country: Russia,  Murmansk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Murmashi

Described by the Russian government as a TAP - Temporary accommodation centre, this facility is part of a wide 66 camp network that houses Ukrainians that have been confirmed to or potentially have been forcefully sent there by the Russian Government.

Date of discovery: 07 May 2022
Country: Russia
City/Town/Village: Vladivostok 

Russian local newspaper reported in late April that about 300 Ukrainian civilians, including 86 children, pregnant women and pensioners, arrived in Vladivostok after an exhausting seven-day journey on the Trans-Siberian Express from Taganrog. The new arrivals, including survivors of the Mariupol siege, were taken to the Vostok hotel complex on the coast near Nakhodka. It is assumed that the Ukrainians did not choose to arrive here and were victims of forced deportation during wartime.

Date of discovery: 07 May 2022
Province: Donetsk and Kherson Oblasts
City/Town/Village: Bezymenne and Kozatske 

Mayor of Mariupol Vadym Boichenko has stated that around 2,000 men are being held in so-called “filtration centres” in Bezymenne and Kozatske, and not being allowed to return to their homes unless they are sick or injured. “They are being used as labour to clear the rubble, collect the dead bodies of those the Russians have killed, and cover up evidence of war crimes,” Boichenko said in a BBC interview.
Events.location: Donetsk and Kherson Oblasts  Bezymenne and Kozatske

Events.description:
Date of discovery: 14 May 2022
 Province: Penza Oblast 
Country/Town/Village: Leonidovka 

The camp is located on a site which was used for decades as a dump for Soviet chemical weapons, according to [inews.co.uk](https://inews.co.uk/news/mariupol-ukraine-russia-war-leonidovka-putin-1579199).

Date of discovery:  15 May 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Olenivka 

Yenakiyeve Correctional Colony No. 52, Yaltinska Street / 2a Yaltinskaya Street, Olenivka, Yenakiyeve. Used for detention of non-active-duty military personnel, law enforcement officers, activists and journalists.  There seems to be some confusion, both in the media and on the MapHub map, over the exact locations of a prison in Olenivka. There are two places in Donetsk Oblast called Olenivka, both of which have a correctional colony - one in Volnovakha District, south of Donetsk city (No. 120) and one near the town of Yenakiyeve, north-east of Donetsk city. Both have been used to detain Ukrainians. No. 120 was the one which was bombed on 29 July.

Date of Discovery: 17 May 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Olenivka

More than 3,000 civilians in Mariupol are being held by Russian forces in a "filtration prison" located in former correctional facility № 52 in the village of Olenivka, Donetsk region.

Date of discovery: 18 May 2022
Country: Russia, Ryazan Oblast
City/Town/Village: Ryazhka

SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 2, 1a Krasnaya Street, Ryazhka - according to Current Time's sources, 219 Ukrainians, including civilians, were detained here (unknown for how long); Russian Federal Prison Service would not confirm presence of Ukrainians. Article 49 of the Geneva Conventions states that "Individual or mass forcible transfers, as well as deportations of protected persons from occupied territory to the territory of the Occupying Power or to that of any other country, occupied or not, are prohibited, regardless of their motive".

Date of discovery: 19 May 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Makiivka

Correctional Colony No. 97 used for detention of Ukrainian solders

The multidisciplinary college is one of three TACs organised in the region. As of November 2022, there were three TACs organised in the region for refugees from the so-called NVO zone, according to this [article](https://kherson-news.ru/society/2022/11/22/69423.html).

This rest house is one of three TACs organised in the region.

IK [Correctional Colony] No. 19 - 99 Ordzhonikidze Street, Surovikino - POWs apparently held in remand facilities within colony, which had been emptied of Russian detainees, according to a former member of the local Public Monitoring Commission.

Date of Discovery: 11 July 2022
Russian forces are taking Ukrainian civilians from Lysychansk to the filtration camps in occupied Kadiivka.

- Human rights Ombudwomen for the Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada Lyudmila Denisova.

Date of discovery: 15 July  2022 
Province: Samara Oblast  
Country/Town/Village: Kinek-Cherkassy district 

In July 2022, 112 children arrived by train from Donetsk, Snezhnoe, Gorlovka and Makeevka for “recreation and health improvement” at the [Kolos sanatorium](https://spark-interfax.ru/samarskaya-oblast-kinel-cherkasski-raion/ooo-kolos-inn-6372000604-ogrn-1026303717439-489b470a9d9a40b599f4e1d3793a93b3).

Province: Khabarovsk Territory

In July 2022, Ombudsman Petr Perevezentsev visited the Ocean children camp, which hosted children from Donetsk and Luhansk.

In the Moscow region, one of the TACs for refugees is located in Klin, and is named "Sounding Voices" (Звонкие голоса). 

According to [360tv.ru](https://360tv.ru/news/mosobl/podmoskove-uvelichilo-kolichestvo-punktov-vremennogo-razmeschenija-dlja-zhitelej-donbassa-i-belgoroda/), as of  end-2022, there were 12 TACs in the Moscow region receiving refugees from Donbass and Belgorod.

Date of discovery: 19 September 2022
Province: Kharkiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Izyum

Izyum City Railway Polyclinic on 35 Zavodska Street: Russian troops detained Ukrainian soldiers and civilians inside crowded, windowless garages at the polyclinic; Ukrainian intelligence officials have said that women were raped there; two captured Ukrainian soldiers separately described to Associated Press how they heard women's screams and were themselves tortured.

Date of discovery: 21 September 2022
Country: Russia, Voronezh Oblast
City/Town/Village: Borisoglebsk

SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 2, 39 Sovetskaya Street: a source in the Russian prison service (FSIN) told Gulagu.net that there are over 250 POWs being held here and in Correctional Colony No. 9 "without legal status". The source shared a letter from the commander of the Voronezh garrison to the acting head of the Voronezh Oblast FSIN branch asking him to assign vehicles and drivers to transport "119 people who showed opposition to the carrying out by the Russian Federation of a special military operation on the territory of Ukraine" from the Baltimor aerodrome in Voronezh to SIZO No. 2.

Date of discovery: 21 September 2022
Country: Russia, Voronezh Oblast
City/Town/Village: Borisoglebsk

IK [Correctional Colony] No. 9, 40 let Oktyabrya Street: a source in the Russian prison service (FSIN) told Gulagu.net that there are over 250 POWs being held here and in SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 2 "without legal status".

According to the investigation, on the night of October 1, 2023, the Russian army struck the village. Children of the Druzhkiv city community. The private sector was affected by the weapon, probably the S-300 complex missile. As a result of the destruction of one of the residential buildings, the whole family was injured - a 40-year-old man with his 36-year-old wife and their 16-year-old son with his 57-year-old grandmother.
In total, 15 private residential buildings and commercial buildings were damaged as a result of the shelling.

Following Russian artillery strikes, a woman, 47, was injured in Kamianske. Another woman, 64, received injuries in Orikhiv. Both victims were promptly taken to hospital.

Nineteen reports were submitted on the damage caused to residential houses and infrastructure objects by Russian attacks.

A man born in 1952 (named as Volodymyr by locals) and a woman born in 1977 were killed. Two more people were injured.

See also: https://suspilne.media/589007-divom-ucilili-ziteli-sela-bilenke-zaporizkogo-rajonu-pro-naslidki-rankovogo-rosijskogo-obstrilu/

"Satellite imagery reveals a mass grave site about 12 miles west of Ukraine's besieged city of Mariupol. 

Russian soldiers have been reportedly taking the bodies of people killed in Mariupol to this site in Manhush, Ukraine that contains more than 200 graves."

Province:  Kherson Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Henichesk

The mayor of Henichesk, Oleksandr Tulupov, was last seen on 9 March. Later, Russian forces announced Tulupov had "voluntarily resigned” and replaced with a new mayor, Gennady Sivak, who had lived in annexed Crimea for eight years.

Date of discovery: 23 April 2022
Province:  Kherson Oblast
 City/Town/Village: Henichesk

In Henichesk, Ukrainian flags have been ripped from civic buildings an replaced with Russian and soviet flags and a statute of Lenin, purge of Ukrainian politicians is under way and plans to planning to hold a sham independence referendum in the southern oblast, to be part of a “People’s Republic of Kherson” or directly under Russian Federation.

Date of discovery: 29 April 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Mariupol

On April 23, in Mariupol, the Russian authorities issued such a certificate to a new-born boy whose mother was unable to evacuate to the safe territory of Ukraine. Such actions of the Russian Federation violate the rights of children enshrined in the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child, in particular Article 8, which provides for the right of the child to preserve his or her identity, including citizenship, name and family ties. Reported by Lyudmila Denisova, human rights Ombudsman

Date of discovery: 30 April 2022
Province:  Luhansk Oblast

"In the city of Rubezhnoye, captured and destroyed by the Russian army, there are a lot of dead civilians, so they are simply buried in mass graves. Huge trenches for corpses were dug on the outskirts of the city," journalist Denis Kazansky reported.

Date of discovery: 9 May 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Vynohradne

Video and satellite footage of a mass grave in the village of Vynohradne, Donetsk region. This is where the Russian military brings the dead civilians of Mariupol. Hundreds and hundreds of people are buried in the ground without even being identified.

Date of discovery: 11 May 2022
Province:  Zaporizhzhia Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Melitopol

According to the Office of the Prosecutor General of Ukraine, in April 2022, the military and representatives of the occupation administration of the aggressor country stole historical and cultural values from the Melitopol Museum of Local Lore. According to preliminary data, among the stolen property was a collection of Scythian gold discovered by archaeologists in the 50s of the last century.

Date of discovery: 14 May 2022
Province:  Zaporizhzhia Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Melitopol

About 500,000 tons of grain have already been stolen by Russian Forces from Melitopol alone, since April. It is reported that up to 70% of the harvest of each farmer is demanded by the Russians.

Date of discovery: 14 May 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Mariupol

Evacuated residents of Mariupol report that Russian servicemen practice interrogating children in order to verify the authenticity of the testimony of their parents.

First, the adults are interrogated, and then, their children, trying to find contradictions. The Russian forces  take advantage of the fact that children experience horror and defenselessness in front of the armed military of another country. Reported by the Commissioner of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine for Human Rights Lyudmyla Denisova.

Date of discovery: 13 June 2022
Province:  Zaporizhzhia Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Melitopol

33 Ukrainian drivers who were evacuating civilians from Mariupol and other cities are in Russian captivity, Ukrainska Pravda reported citing their family members. Russia reportedly accuses them of terrorism and wants to imprison them for 10-15 years. They have been held captive for nearly 2 months begining their captivity at a camp in this town and then driven to various prisons in Donetsk region by their Russian captors.

Date of discovery: 23 June 2022
City/ Town/ Village: Yunakivka

Small fires visible on the side of the road, possibly phosphorus capsules.

Date of discovery: 09 July 2022

Russian occupation forces are organizing a two-stage referendum in the temporarily occupied Berdyansk on joining Russia. It is scheduled for September 11th. At the first stage of the so called referendum, "voting" at polling stations is planned. Furthermore, due to the possibility of lack of support of the local population,  a second stage for the referendum is envisaged which is bribery of locals apartment-by-apartment. 

"To do this, all heads of condominiums were forced to collect apartment-by-apartment lists of those willing to receive 10,000 rubles or humanitarian aid.  They will be included in the lists of those who voted - automatically. Thus, the second stage will provide an opportunity to falsify the vote, including at the expense of citizens who have left.  In addition, employees of captured public utilities and public sector institutions will automatically "vote", because their data was collected by the Russians in advance.

These actions of the Russian federation are a gross violation of the fundamental principles of sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, the requirements of Article 2 of the UN Charter and the Declaration on the Principles of International Law.". Reported by human rights Ombudsman for the Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada Lyudmila Denisova.

Date of discovery: 11 July 2022

"The Russian occupation administration of Ilovaisk, Donetsk region, has announced that the water supply in the city will be stopped. The lack of water puts the city's residents on the edge of survival. Such actions are another violation by the russian federation of the requirements of the 1949 Geneva Convention on the Protection of the Civilian Population in Time of War." . Reported by human rights Ombudsman for the Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada Lyudmila Denisova.

Date of discovery: 12 July 2022

The Russian Military has been shelling crops in the Kherson, Zaporizhzhya, and Dnipropetrovsk regions, as a result of which hectares of grain crops have burned causing grain and wheat shortages for both the export and local market. As well as potentially leading to starvation of many people. Reported by human rights Ombudsman for the Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada Lyudmila Denisova.

Date of discovery: 13 July 2022

The Russian military is promoting its citizens from the poor regions of Russia – for example; Yakutia and Buryatiya, to settle on occupied Ukrainian territory such as Melitopol, Berdyansk, and Energodar. 

The “settlers” (illegal settlers) move into the apartments of the Ukrainian citizens in this cities who have abandoned their properties in the wake of the Russian invasion in order to escape towards Ukrainian controlled territory. Potentially violating article 33 of the Geneva convention on the Protection of the Civilian Population in Time of War. Reported by Human rights Ombudsman for  the Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada Lyudmila Denisova

Date of discovery: 06 February 2023, Village: Novoselivske, Luhansk. Destruction of Novoselivske.

Date of Discovery: 09 March 2022 
Province:  Kyiv Oblast 

"Russian soldier Mikhail Romanov, is accused of having repeatedly raped a woman in the Kyiv region after murdering her husband". The Russian soldier is being tried in absentia under Article 262 of the Criminal Procedural Code of Ukraine.

Date of discovery: 16 March 2022 
Province:  Kyiv Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Bucha

23-year-old  Karina Yershova from Bucha was abducted, raped, tortured and shot dead.

Date of discovery: 26 March 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Mariupol

Kateryna, 19, was  sheltering in a basement in Mariupol when Chechen soldiers wearing black balaclavas came and asked to check documents, on March 26, just weeks after Russian forces entered the city. "They had rifles slung over their shoulders, she recalled, and they seemed drunk," she recalled. One of the soldiers told her she needed to come upstairs to be examined and then raped her, threatening to kill her if she resists.

Date of discovery: 28 March 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Mariupol

Nastya, 19, was hiding together with her sister and grandmother iin the basement of their house which was badly damaged by a bomb in March. On March 27 or 28, they got out to find clean clothes and encountered five Russian soldiers which pointed thei guns towards them and put garbage bags over their heads. Soldiers agreed to let Nastya's family members go, if she was "obedient". she was raped for several days by various men until a drugged or drunk Russian soldier took her outside to assault her. The soldier fell and Nastya ran away with her hands tied. She reached a random bulding where she fainted and was found by two women who took her to the hospital.

Date of Discovery: 5 April 2022
In the Kharkiv region, the russian occupier raped a 29-year-old woman caring for her immobile mother for more than a week. The woman repeatedly experienced sexual violence on his part, but was unable to reach law enforcement.  Soon a militant broke her phone. A week later, the racist began to talk to the woman about love and offered to send her away from the war.  In response to the woman's refusal due to the inability to leave the mother, the villain simply shot the old woman in front of her daughter. The woman managed to escape and is now undergoing rehabilitation. Reported by Ombudsman Lyudmyla Denisova.

Date of discovery: 05 April 2022
City/ Town/ Village:Bezimenne


Reported "Filtration camp" used to process Ukrainians from Mariupol.

Date of Discovery: 5 April 2022
In the village of Mala Rohan in the Kharkiv region, a russian militant beat and repeatedly raped a 31-year-old woman who was hiding at a school with her 5-year-old daughter, mother, sister, brother and other residents of the village. Holding a weapon near her head, the racist repeatedly sexually assaulted a woman who he said reminded him of the girl he went to school with. A russian militant cut the woman's neck and cheek with a knife, cut her hair, and hit her in the face with a book.  When the racists left, the woman and her family managed to walk to Kharkiv and receive the necessary medical care.

Date of Discovery: April 8 2022
A 14-year-old girl was raped by 5 occupying men.  She is pregnant now.  Bucha.
An 11-year-old boy was raped in front of his mother - she was tied to a chair to watch.
reported by Ukraine’s official ombudswoman for human rights, Lyudmyla Denisova

Date of Discovery: 08 April 2022
Province: Kherson Oblast
City/ Town/ Village: Kryvyi Rih

Russian troops raped a pregnant young girl and an old woman at the temporarily occupied territories, according to Oleksandr Vilkul, the Head of Kryvyi Rih Military Administration.

Date of Discovery: 10 April 2022
In Irpen, a 20-year-old pregnant woman was raped by two racists.  Unfortunately she lost the child.  Reported by Ombudsman Lyudmyla Denisova.

Date of Discovery: 22 April 2022
In Irpen, three Russian soldiers raped a mother and her 15-year-old younger daughter while the other daughter had to witness it. Both women are unfortunately dead. and the surviving girl is in a state of psychological shock who had to live with the corpses in the house for 4 days. report documented from Ombudsman Lyudmyla Denisova.

Date of Discovery: 22 April 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/ Town/ Village: Bucha

A group of women and girls were kept in a basement of a house, in Bucha for 25 days. Nine of them are now pregnant, says Ukraine’s official ombudswoman for human rights, Lyudmyla Denisova

Date of Discovery: 19 may 2022
Russian soldiers raped two elderly men aged 67 and 78. - reported by Ukrainian Parliament Commissioner for Human Rights, Lyudmyla Denisova. 
(Geolocation: not possible at the moment)

Date of Discovery: 19 may 2022
Triplet girls, 9 years old, raped by Russian soldiers in front of their mother - causing severe genital injuries to them. - reported by Ukrainian Parliament Commissioner for Human Rights, Lyudmyla Denisova.

Date of Discovery: 19 May 2022
Province: Kharkiv Oblast

The Ukrainian Armed Forces are liberating towns and villages in the Kharkiv region, and over the past week, a lot of reports of sexual assault and rape of Ukrainian civilians including children and the elderly. 
In one day 56 reports of rape and sexual assault were made to the Ukrainian Human rights Commissioner's Psychological Assistance Line.

Date of Discovery: 23 may 2022
2 two-year-old twin boys and their mother were at home.  Five Russian soldiers broke in, one held the mother, the other two raped the children orally and anal. The children died from ruptures and blood loss. - Reported by the Human Rights Commissioner's psychological helpline in Ukraine

Date of Discovery: 23 may 2022
Two girls aged 12 and 15 were raped by Russian soldiers and a 6-month-old girl was raped by a Russian soldier. - Reported by the Human Rights Commissioner's psychological helpline in Ukraine

Province:  Chernihiv Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Chernihiv 

The Chernihiv Regional Prosecutor's Office identified two servicemen of the Russian armed forces who attempted to rape a 16-year-old girl and tortured the girl’s older brother with the help of
other soldiers.

Date of Discovery 05/08/2022 
Province:  Zaporizhzhia Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Melitopol

"A 13-year-old girl was found murdered in the temporarily occupied Melitopol. A terrible find was discovered by local residents in the park. A dog dog dug the child's hand out of the ground. As close relatives of the deceased girl said, she was raped and beaten before her death."

Date of discovery: 26 August 2022
Province: Kharkiv Oblast

Poland gynecologist Agnieszka Kurczuk recounts the case of a 21-year old girl from Kharkiv who fled to Poland after being gang-raped by Russian Soldiers. "She had severe PTSD, post-traumatic stress disorder. She could not tell where and when it happened,” Kurchuk recalls.

In Mariupol, the Russian soldiers took turns raping a woman in front of her 6-year-old son for several days.  The woman died of her wounds. Reported by Ukraine’s official ombudswoman for human rights, Lyudmyla Denisova

During the occupation of one of the villages in Brovary district, a russian officer shot the owner of the house, after which he repeatedly raped the victim's wife in a state of alcohol intoxication together with another russian soldiers, threatening the woman and her child with violence. Reported by Ukraine’s official ombudswoman for human rights, Lyudmyla Denisova

Date of discovery: 05 April 2022
City/ Town/ Village:Bezimenne


Reported "Filtration camp" used to process Ukrainians from Mariupol.

Province: Luhansk Oblast

A tank with nitric acid was allegedly hit by Russian shelling causing massive leaks of toxic gas and liquid. Locals were requested to say in shelters, close windows. 

P.S - LPR (separatist media) claim it was actually blown up by Ukrainian forces, however, no evidence to suggest such thing as of yet.

More images taken in June on the site in this Twitter [post](https://twitter.com/wammezz/status/1539920457570390016?s=20&t=VMXLiZWORpSYROcH35hh2Q).

Date of Discovery: 9 April 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Chernobyl 

While occupying the Chernobyl exclusion zone, Russian forces (for some reason) dug trenches in the HIGHLY radioactive "Red Forest", thus unearthing radioactive soil and dust that was hidden underground for decades. 
"Chief of Ukraine’s Energoatom Petro Kotin visited one of the areas in the Chornobyl Exclusion Zone, where the Russian forces had been digging trenches. The official says all Russian soldiers, who have already retreated from the area, are now facing radiation sickness".

Date of Discovery: 15 May 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Mariupol

Signs of leakage from the Azovstal plant, of chemicals that could be damaging to the marine ecosystem of the Azov sea.

Date of discovery 23 June 2022 
Province: Luhansk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Rubizhne

A massive explosion of on-site fertilizer or nitric-acid destroyed the whole structure due to strike
Date of discovery 31 January 2024 Province: Odesa Oblast City/Town/Village: Izmail A Russian strike on the port of Izmail destroyed buildings and damaged almost 40,000 tons of grain.

Russian occupying forces have set up training facilities inside the Pryazovsky National Nature Park, Ukraine's second-largest national park, damaging habitats with mortar fire and cutting down trees. The Zaporizhzhia Regional Military Administration has warned that "an ecological disaster is brewing".

Geolocation approximate.

Soldiers in Russian uniform appear to shoot at person filming them.

Date of discovery: 03 March 2022
Province: Poltava Oblast
City/Town/Village: Andriivka

23-year-old Anton Ishchenko was among those killed by Russian forces, his grandfather told Amnesty International. Two villagers who were detained by Russian forces, which occupied the village for three weeks in March, told Amnesty that Anton had been held with them. “Anton was arrested on 3 March, the day after his birthday,” recalled Andrii Hilazunov, one of the two. “When he was brought to where we were held he was in a bad way. He had been badly beaten ... He tried to escape and was shot dead.”

Date of discovery: 03 March 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Vorzel

15-year-old boy Igor Denchik and his aunt Ludmila Shabanova were shot dead by Russian soldiers in front of their family.

Date of incident: 03 March 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Vorzel

Kateryna Tkachova, 18, was at home in the village of Vorzel with her parents when several tanks displaying the letter ‘Z’ drove down their street. Her parents went outside, asking her to stay inside. She heard gunshots. Later, when the tanks had left, she found the bodies of her dead parents.

Date of discovery: 04 March 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Bucha

Yevhen Petrashenko, a 43-year-old sales manager and father of two, was shot dead in his apartment on the ground floor of the building at 203A Yablunska Street. Amnesty International researchers found two bullets and three cartridge cases at the scene of the incident. The organization’s weapons investigator identified the bullets as armour-piercing 9x39mm rounds that can only be fired by rifles used by a few specialized Russian units, such as Russian Airborne Forces (VDV) and special forces (Spetsnaz), reported to have been operating in Bucha during this period.

Date of discovery:04 March 2022
City/ Town/ Village:Hurivshchyna, Kyiv oblast

Civilian killed in vehicle.

Date of Discovery: 04 March 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Kyiv

Russian soldiers killed a Ukrainian army volunteer on the outskirts of Kyiv and left his dead body in his car trunk fitted with a mine that later exploded when Ukrainian forces attempted to move him. Exact geolocation pending

Date of discovery: 05 March 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Bucha

Dmytro Konovalov, a 41-year-old electrician, was shot dead outside the building  where he lived with his brothers and his mother.

Date of discovery: 05 March 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Bucha

Russian soldiers stormed the family home of Irina Abramov and held her, her husband Oleh, and her father Volodymyr at gunpoint before taking Oleh outside and killing him on the pavement outside the house. The house was was set on fire by the soldiers.

.... that residents of a property in a neighbouring block that belongs to the same apartment complex were not so fortunate. “Soldiers there just threw in a grenade when they opened the door,” she says, her voice cracking briefly with emotion.

Video indicates that an Ukrainian protestor got shot in the leg by the Russian army while chanting Ukraine and standing against Russian invasion.

The bodies of Oleksander Shylan, age 26, Olexi Presazhni, age 40, and Igor Servinsky were found on the northern edge of the village.

Russian troops deliberately targeted civilians fleeing from the village of Irpin. At least three members of a family of four were killed.

Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Makariv Raion

Olexandr Sechevky, age 62, and his daughter-in-law Olha Sechevky, age 32, were both killed when the car they were traveling in was fired upon by what were believed to be Russian forces. Olha’s son Mykola, age 7, was injured in the incident.  The stretch they were attempting to cross was between the towns of Lypivka and Khorolivka, about 9 km from Makariv.

The son of Serhiy Zakhliupanyy was taken away by Russian forces and was later found dead, shot in the head.

What appears to be a body in a residential area. No information about how they died.

Date of discovery: 15 March 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast

The Russian military tried to burn down the bodies of a family with children to cover up their crimes.

Date of Discovery: 15 March 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Kyiv

The Russian forces shot a family that was trying to evacuate  from a BMP (infantry fighting vehicle). The family car with their bodies was found by law enforcement officers after the Russian forces left the region.

Date of discovery: 15 March 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Babintsi

Pavlo Kholodenko and Viktor Balay appear to have been summarily killed by Russian forces. Their bodies were left partially buried in a foxhole in a forest on the outskirts of the village, where Russian soldiers had camped during their occupation of the area.  Relatives of the two men told Amnesty that when the bodies were recovered their hands were tied behind their back and they both had been shot in the head. Photographs of the bodies seen by Amnesty International are consistent with this description. In addition to having his hands tied behind his back, Victor Balay’s body had clear tape wrapped around the face and head.

Date of discovery: 16 March 2022
Province: Chernihiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Chernihiv
Ten people waiting in line for bread were hit by a missile.

Date of discovery: March 17 2022

Huseyn Abdullayev, a third-year student at Mariupol State University, was taken prisoner by Russian invaders as he attempted to leave the city on March 17.  "Abdullayev repeatedly emphasized that he was Azerbaijani and showed documents, but the invaders, using electric shocks, tried to get him to falsely confess that he was a soldier of the Azov Regiment." - Lyudmila Denisova Human Rights Ombudsman for Ukrainian Parliament. More on his story [here](https://www.voanews.com/a/azerbaijani-student-held-in-russian-captivity-in-mariupol-ukraine-describes-torture/6534579.html).

Date of discovery: 19 March 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Bucha

Leonid Goy, the neighbour who had discovered the lifeless body of Yevhen Petrashenko, was killed. A neighbour who witnessed the killing told Amnesty International that Goy, a 51-year-old factory worker, was shot in the courtyard at the back of building 203A.

Date of Discovery: 23 March 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Bucha

Leonid Bodnarchuk, a 44-year-old construction worker, was killed on 22 or 23 March. Neighbours who were in the basement at the time told Amnesty International that Russian soldiers shot Bodnarchuk as he was walking up the basement stairs, and then threw a grenade into the stairwell.

Aleksander Yeremich, a 43-year-old railway inspector and father of two, was taken from his friend’s farm on the edge of Bucha, marched to the edge of the forest outside the house, and extrajudicially executed.

[graphic: bodies] seven bodies in civilian clothes killed, at least two with hands tied behind their backs. Russian army ration packs & ammunitions container present at the site.

Demonstrations against occupation were violently dispersed. Furthermore, a different part of town has been shelled resulting in four wounded.

Antonina Pomazenko shows Ukrainian forces the dead body of her daughter in Bucha. The daughter stepped outside the house after she heard noise and was instantly shot to death by Russian forces. Exact geolocation pending.

[graphic: bodies, head] Several dead bodies, including one that has been decapitated.

Date of discovery: 07 April 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast

In the cellar of a small shed located in the garden of a house off Vokzal’na Street, the body of a woman was found when the Russian soldiers left Bucha, in early April. The owner of the house told Amnesty International that they left it on 3 March and when they returned on 7 April they found the body of the woman slumped on the floor of the cellar. They said her body was naked and wrapped in a fur coat; part of her head was missing, and she had open wounds on the front of her thighs, abdomen and upper chest. She was later identified.

Date of discovery: 07 April 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast

11 murdered civilians were found in a garage in Hostomel. Reports indicate that Russian snipers used them for target practice.

A murdered family (father, mother, child) was found in a bullet-ridden car at Hostomel. Civilians tried to escape Russian forces through the woods but many didn't make it. Exact geolocation pending

A group of recruiters arrived in Russian occupied Kherson looking for people ready to work for the DNR Special Services. They held "demonstrative filtering events"  during which they killed and tortured some 50 civilians and abducted about 120 residents.

At least four lawyers have already been abducted prisoner by Russian forces and interrogated and tortured under captivity. Exact geolocation pending

Drone footage of an individual with their hands up dressed in civilian clothes appearing to be shot by people with white bands around their limbs, from a position where there is a tank with a white "V" marked on it.



BBC report …

Province: Kherson Oblast
City/Town/Village: near Dovhove

Strike from point-blank range using an anti-tank guided missile on a bus carrying civilian evacuees killed 3, wounded 5. Additional information on the strike [here](https://t.me/vilkul/1666).

Date of discovery: 20 September 2022
City/Town/Village: Vovchansk

Seven Sri Lankans were captured by Russian forces in May and were blindfolded, their hands tied, and taken to a machine tool factory in the town of Vovchansk. They were held for four months and the group was surviving on very little food, only allowed to use the toilet once a day for two minutes. On occasions, they were allowed to shower, but that too was restricted to just two minutes.

Date of discovery: 25 September 2022
City/Town/Village: Kurylivka

A convoy of six civilian cars near the village of Kurylivka in the Kupiansk district was shelled, resulting in the death of at least 22 including 10 children. The civilians were shelled during an evacuation.

Three Russian missiles hit civilian vehicles waiting to cross a checkpoint into occupied territory. 32 dead, over 80 wounded. Additional information available [here](https://archive.ph/8BNaL) and [here](https://www.rferl.org/a/russia-zaporizhzhya-strike-convoy-deaths-ukraine/32059081.html).

Events.description:
Date of discovery: 27/10/2023
City/Town/Village: Volnovakha
Russian soldiers entered the house of the Kapkanets family at night and shot all 9 members while they were sleeping. Exact geolocation pending.

Date of incident: 03 March, 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Hostomel

Taras Kuzmak was driving around delivering food and medication to bomb shelters where civilians were gathering. At 1.30pm on March 3, the car which was also carrying the city’s mayor, Yuryi Prylypko and two other men came under gunfire from the direction of a large residential complex that had been seized by Russian forces. One man, Ivan Zorya, was killed immediately, while Prylypko was shot and later  died from the injuries. Kuzmak and the other surviving man hid behind an excavator for hours as shooting continued.

Date of Discovery: 22 March 2022
Province: Luhansk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Pervomais'k

Video showing the the dead bodies of Ukrainian soldiers who seem to be lined up in a straight line (execution style) and have gun shot wounds on their bodies.

Date of discovery: 04 April 2022, confirmed 9 September 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Olenivka, Molodizhne

Ukrainian Marines captain and medic Mariana Mamonova is being held in Correctional Colony No. 120 in the village of Molodizhne near Olenivka, despite being pregnant. She was first identified among prisoners captured in Mariupol on 4 April in a video posted on Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov's Telegram channel - her family confirmed her whereabouts and pregnancy to the BBC on 9 September.

After five months of captivity, she was released during a major prisoner swap on September 21 2022.

According to the Kyiv Independent, Mamonova shared a small, decrepit prison cell with 40 other women and was forced to sleep on the cold floor under one of the bunk beds with nothing but a thin blanket. She also said that Russian soldiers interrogated her multiple times, threatening to take her baby from her.

Date of discovery: 05 April 2022
City/ Town/ Village:Bezimenne


Reported "Filtration camp" used to process Ukrainians from Mariupol.

Date of Discovery: 14 April 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Mariupol

Ukrainian Marine Aiden Aislin (also a British citizen) was captured by Russian forces in early April in Mariupol after his unit surrendered as their supplies ran out, following their lengthy defence of the city. According to various outlets, including the BBC, Aiden was released in a prisoner exchange in September 2022.

Date of discovery: 20 April 2022

On April 20th, Russian forces posted a video of prisoners of war and reports that people had voluntarily surrendered. Days later the the POW that was in Russian captivity has been found, shot dead. His tattoo was used to initially identify the POW. Exact geolocation pending.

Date of Discovery: 28 April 2022
Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Kozarovychi

Volodymyr Khropun, a Red Cross volunteer, was abducted by the Russian military in the village of Kozarovychi. For the first few days, he and other prisoners were held in the basement of the factory in the nearby village of Dymer.  About 40 prisoners were kept in the 28 sq m room with him.

"We were beaten with rifles, punched, and kicked. They blindfolded me and tied my hands with duct tape. They used Tasers and kept asking for information about the military," Volodymyr said.

He and the rest were held in Ukraine for almost a week and later transported to Belarus. Then, they were taken to a Russian prison, where the torture continued.

Date of Discovery: 01 May 2022
Province: Kherson Oblast
City/Town/Village: Aprikosivka

Russian Forces killed a veteran of the anti-terrorist operation from the village of Aprikosivka, Kherson region Nazar Kagalnyak.

Russian Soldiers later brought Nazar, who had been tortured, to his home, where his condition critically deteriorated. The man was eventually taken to the hospital in Oleshka, where he later died.

Date of discovery: 28 May 2022
Country: Russia
City/Town/Village: Taganrog

Ukrainian soldiers captured in Mariupol beaten, kicked, threatened with murder, tortured with pliers, and given electric shocks during transfer between Russian-occupied areas of Ukraine and Russian detention centres, according to the office of the Ukrainian Parliamentary Ombudsman for Human Rights.

Date of discovery : 28 May 2022

Ukrainian soldiers captured in Mariupol beaten, kicked, threatened with murder, tortured with pliers, and given electric shocks during transfer between Russian-occupied areas of Ukraine and Russian detention centres, according to the office of the Ukrainian Parliamentary Ombudsman for Human Rights. It is unclear to which of the Voronezh Region's three pre-trial detention centres (No. 1 and No. 3 in Voronezh, No. 2 in Borisoglebsk) this might refer.
location: Voronezh, Russia

Date of discovery : 28 May 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Mariupol

Female soldiers captured in Mariupol held in detention centre in Donetsk and forced to perform sexual acts - guards applied psychological pressure by beating male prisoners in front of them.

Date of discovery : 01 June 2022
Country: Russia
City/Town/Village: Kursk

Two Ukrainian pilots, with broken legs they had sustained when their plane was shot down, were not allowed to lie down during the day and experienced insufficient medical care in captivity at SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 1 in Kursk, including having to make their own wound dressings with limited supplies of toilet paper.

Date of discovery: 09 June 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast 

British citizens Shaun Pinner and Aiden Aslin and Moroccan citizen Brahim Saadun - all resident in Ukraine and enlisted in the armed forces before Russia's invasion - were tried on charges of being mercenaries, "forcible seizure of power", "committing a crime in a group", and "training for the purpose of carrying out terrorist activities". The trial took place in the supreme court of the unrecognised so-called Donetsk People's Republic and ended in death sentences for all three defendants. 

All three were released in a prisoner exchange in September.

Date of discovery : 01 July 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Olenivka, Molodizhne

Ukrainian soldiers beaten and tortured on arrival and beaten before interrogation; large-scale torture by guards from the self-proclaimed DNR began after arrival of prisoners from Azovstal, who were also subjected to psychological pressure to give "fabricated testimonies"; civilian prisoners also beaten on arrival but reportedly not tortured thereafter.

Date of Discovery: 22 July 2022
Province: Kherson Oblast
City/Town/Village: Kherson

Three members of the Territorial Defence Forces (who should be treated as POWs) and at least two civilians tortured by suspected FSB officers in the Ukrainian National Police Directorate building (occupied by Russian forces) in Kherson from 27 March onwards.
A survivor who got out in a prisoner exchange described how they were beaten, given electric shocks, suffocated with plastic bags, and left in cells for weeks without medical treatment or sufficient food; two Territorial Defence Forces servicemen (Denis Mironov ad Vitaly Lapchuk) and one civilian ("Serhii") later died - Lapchuk's body was found weighted down in the sea, his arms bound.

Date of discovery:  28 July 2022
Province: Luhansk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Popasna

Russian soldiers allegedly cut off a Ukrainian soldier's head and hands and stuck them on spikes on a garden fence at 21 Nahirna Street / Nagornaya Street, Popasna. Seven-second video posted on Russian Telegram channel shows a body in military uniform, without a head or apparently hands, lying near a fence; the camera swings up to show what appears to be a decomposed head and hands on the spikes of the fence. Photo of same scene from further away posted by Luhansk governor Serhii Haidai on his Telegram channel on 5 August. The identity of the soldier and the circumstances of his death are unknown, but the mutilation of bodies is itself a war crime ("Committing outrages upon personal dignity").

Date of Discovery: 28 July 2022
Province: Luhansk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Pryvillya

Unidentified soldier in Ukrainian uniform castrated and shot in the head at Privolye sanatorium near the town of Privillya - the perpetrator is possibly a member of the Chechen "Akhmat" paramilitary group serving with the Russian Army, but identification is uncertain.

Date of Discovery: 29 July 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Olenivka

Russian propaganda media claimed a penal colony in Olenivka, near Russian-occupied Donetsk, where Ukrainian POWs were kept, was shelled.  RIA Novosti reported that 53 were killed and 75 injured. 

Russia claimed Ukraine did this with HIMARS weapons, but military experts have rebuked this claim. 

According to the Ukrainian intelligence sources, the killing of Ukrainian prisoners in Olenivka was organized by the PMC Wagner on the personal instructions from Yevgeny Prigozhin (Russian oligarch and a close confidant of Putin), without coordination with the the Russian Ministry of Defense. 

The Defence Intelligence of the Ministry of Defence of Ukraine (GUR) states that the explosion was carried out to cover up the theft of funds allocated to the Ukrainian prisoners. According to GUR, on 1 August, a commission from Russia was due to arrive at the colony to check how the funds were used and the conditions of their detention.

Date of discovery : 04 August 2022
Country: Russia,  Tver Oblast
City/Town/Village: Kashin

Local Telegram channel Zakroy zamnoy Tver reports that Ukrainian soldiers held in SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 2 in Kashin (31 Krasnaya Street) have been beaten, tortured, and forced to dance to Russian songs; according to Ukrainian commentator Dmytro Snegirov, detainees have been subjected to "physical and psychological pressure" and forced to appear in staged videos.

Date of Discovery: 13 August 2022
Country: Russia, Belgorod Oblast, 
City/Town/Village: Stary Oskol

Border guards captured on Snake Island arrived at SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 2 in Stary Oskol in mid March, where guards beat them with rubber truncheons and threatened to sic the dogs on them.

Date of Discovery: 13 August 2022
Country: Russia, Belgorod Oblast, 
City/Town/Village: Stary Oskol

Father Vasily Vyrozub, Father Aleksandr Chokov (both from the  Orthodox Church of Ukraine), and possibly also several Protestant pastors were captured when they went to retrieve the bodies of troops believed to be killed in the Russian attack on Snake Island.

The clergy members were beaten and tortured during interrogation at SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 2 in Stary Oskol. Father Vasily was also held naked for several days in an unheated punishment cell with no toilet and forced to confess to knowing a Ukrainian special forces general.

Date of discovery: 28 August 2022
Country: Ukraine (Mariupol)/ Russia (unknown location)

Igor Mangushev of the ENOT private military company said the skull belonged to a member of the Azov Battalion who had been defending Azovstal in Mariupol. Whether the skull is real, to whom it belongs, and how they died is so far unclear. The date and location of Mangshev's speech are unknown.

Date of discovery: 09 September 2022: Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Olenivka (unclear which one)

Ukrainian POWs suffering from hepatitis A and tuberculosis held in correctional colony in Olenivka (unclear whether this is No. 120 or No. 52)

Date of discovery: 16 September 2022
Province: Kharkiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Izyum

Investigators have found at least 17 Ukrainian soldiers among the mass burials near the Pishchanske Cemetery on Shekspira Street in northwest Izyum (exact figure unclear), some of whom appear to have died with their hands tied behind their backs.

Date of discovery: 21 September 2022
Country: Russia, Voronezh Oblast
City/Town/Village: Borisoglebsk

IK [Correctional Colony] No. 9: A source in the Russian prison service (FSIN) described to Gulagu.net how personnel of "special purpose units" beat prisoners, give them electric shocks, and make the stand outside for hours. The source claims that some prisoners have died from "multiple beatings".

Date of discovery: 21 September 2022
Country: Russia, Voronezh Oblast
City/Town/Village: Borisoglebsk

SIZO [Detention Centre] No. 2: A source in the Russian prison service (FSIN) described to Gulagu.net how personnel of "special purpose units" beat prisoners, give them electric shocks, and make the stand outside for hours. The source claims that some prisoners have died from "multiple beatings".
location: Borisoglebsk, Voronezh Oblast, Russia

Date of discovery: 02 October 2022
Province: Kharkiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Izyum

At the Izyum City Railway Polyclinic, (35 Zavodska Street), Russian troops detained Ukrainian soldiers and civilians inside crowded, windowless garages at the polyclinic. 

Ukrainian intelligence officials said that women were raped there; two captured Ukrainian soldiers separately described to Associated Press how they heard women's screams and were themselves tortured.

Date of discovery: 02 October 2022
Province: Kharkiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Izyum

At Izyum School No. 2 (12 Ivana Miroshnichenka Street), Russian troops detained Ukrainian soldiers and civilians in the school building, which they also used as a base and field hospital; one captured Ukrainian soldier described to AP how he was beaten, and said that at least two civilians died there.

Date of Discovery: 2 December 2023
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Near Stepove

Russian soldiers execute 2 Ukrainian soldiers that emerged from their trenches to surrender. Exact geolocation pending

Date of discovery: 2023-12-??
Province: Zaporizhzhia Oblast
City/Town/Village: Robotyne

Russian soldiers shot dead three Ukrainian prisoners of war about an hour after capturing them during fighting near the village of Robotyne. The Office of the Ukrainian Prosecutor General has stated that the incident occurred in December (the exact date remains unclear) and has opened a criminal investigation. Precise geolocation not possible but location likely to be a short distance south/southwest/southeast of Robotyne, given combat activities in the area in December.

Province: Donetsk Oblast

Ukrainian POWs beaten and given electric shocks by Russian or pro-Russian separatist forces at the pre-trial detention centre in Donetsk.

Date of Discovery: 26 February 2022 
Province: Kharkiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Saltivka 

On Freelance photojournalist and documentarian Ihor Hudenko had been missing since the beginning of the Russian invasion in February, and was later found dead on Natalia Uzhviy Street in Kharkiv.
https://imi.org.ua/en/news/photographer-ihor-hudenko-found-dead-in-kharkiv-i45724

The pair were clearly identified as journalists on their protective equipment and shouted 'press' during the attack.

Date of Discovery: 13 March 2022 
Province: Kyiv Oblast

Cameraman Pierre Zakrzewski was killed alongside producer Oleksandra Kuvshynova when their vehicle was struck in Horenka, outside of the Ukrainian capital. The Ukrainian ministry of defence blamed Russian troops for the attack.

Province: Kyiv Oblast
City/Town/Village: Horenka

Producer Oleksandra Kuvshynova was killed alongside cameraman Pierre Zakrzewski when their vehicle was struck in Horenka, outside of the Ukrainian capital. The Ukrainian ministry of defence blamed Russian troops for the attack.

Date of Discovery: 14 March 2022 
Province: Kyiv Oblast

Reporter Benjamin Hall was badly injured in the same shelling which killed cameraman Pierre Zakrzewski and producer Oleksandra Kuvshynova in Horenka.

location : Mariupol

location : Mariupol

icon :

description : Date of Discovery: 26 March 2022. On March 23 2022 Channel 24 cameraman Yuriy Oliynyk was killed in battle near the Popasna in Luhansk region. Yuriy Oliynyk went to war for the second time. He fought for the first time in 2014, when Russia occupied Donbas.

Those sources did not state the exact date his body was found and said it appeared to be a "violent" death.

The two Reuters correspondents sitting in the back seat were named as photographer Aleksandr Ermochenko and cameraman Pavel Klimov.

Date of discovery: 19/09/2023
Location: Stepnohirsk, Zaporizhzhia Oblast

A Russian drone appears to have targeted a TV crew from Swedish channel TV4 (Johan Fredriksson, Daniel Zdolsek, and Oleksandr Pavlov). The strike destroyed their car, which was marked with a "Press" sign. The journalists and their police escort were returning to their vehicles after filming and managed to flee the drone, but Ukrainian producer Pavlov and the two police officers were slightly injured.

Geolocated from photographs taken at the scene and Oleksandr Pavlov's description in his interview with the National Union of Journalists of Ukraine.

See also: https://www.tv4.se/artikel/2IFgXfZBsnD6AwbIePSzfM/tv4-s-team-attackerat-av-droenarmissil-vi-hade-tur

sources10.description:
Date of Discovery: 30 April 2022
Country: Russia
City/Town/Village: Kursk

Ukrainian men were taken to prison camps, then to "SIZO I", a prison in the Russian city of Kursk where it has been reported following a prisoner exchange that Ukrainians were dressed like prisoners, tortured, had their hair cut as well as forced to learn patriotic Russian songs and perform them for their supervisors.  Interrogations took place two or three times a day, after which the men were severely beaten and later forced to sign documents stating that they had been treated well. Reported by Ukrainian Ombudsman Lyudmyla Denisova

A man born in 1952 (named as Volodymyr by locals) and a woman born in 1977 were killed. Two more people were injured.

sources1097.description:
Date of discovery: 29 April 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Mariupol

On April 23, in Mariupol, the Russian authorities issued such a certificate to a new-born boy whose mother was unable to evacuate to the safe territory of Ukraine. Such actions of the Russian Federation violate the rights of children enshrined in the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child, in particular Article 8, which provides for the right of the child to preserve his or her identity, including citizenship, name and family ties. Reported by Lyudmila Denisova, human rights Ombudsman
sources1097.title: CIV76147

sources1098.description:

Province:  Zaporizhzhia Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Melitopol

About 500,000 tons of grain have already been stolen by Russian Forces from Melitopol alone, since April. It is reported that up to 70% of the harvest of each farmer is demanded by the Russians.
sources1098.title: CIV63947

Date of discovery: 05/02/2022
Province:  Zaporizhzhia Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Melitopol

27 units of expensive farming equipment were stolen from Melitopol. Thanks to GPS date of the vehicles, it was possible to find out that they were being taken to Chechnya.

The farming equipment is currently assumed to be located on a farm near Grozny.
sources1099.title: CIV95700

Province:  Kherson Oblast
 City/Town/Village: Henichesk

In Henichesk, Ukrainian flags have been ripped from civic buildings an replaced with Russian and soviet flags and a statute of Lenin, purge of Ukrainian politicians is under way and plans to planning to hold a sham independence referendum in the southern oblast, to be part of a “People’s Republic of Kherson” or directly under Russian Federation.
sources1100.title: CIV18552

sources1101.description:
Date of discovery: 23 April 2022
Province:  Kherson Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Henichesk

The mayor of Henichesk, Oleksandr Tulupov, was last seen on 9 March. Later, Russian forces announced Tulupov had "voluntarily resigned” and replaced with a new mayor, Gennady Sivak, who had lived in annexed Crimea for eight years.
sources1101.title: CIV93262

sources1102.description:
Date of discovery: 14 May 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Mariupol

Evacuated residents of Mariupol report that Russian servicemen practice interrogating children in order to verify the authenticity of the testimony of their parents.

First, the adults are interrogated, and then, their children, trying to find contradictions. The Russian forces  take advantage of the fact that children experience horror and defenselessness in front of the armed military of another country. Reported by the Commissioner of the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine for Human Rights Lyudmyla Denisova.
sources1102.title: CIV16032

sources1103.description:
Date of discovery: 11 May 2022
Province:  Zaporizhzhia Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Melitopol

According to the Office of the Prosecutor General of Ukraine, in April 2022, the military and representatives of the occupation administration of the aggressor country stole historical and cultural values from the Melitopol Museum of Local Lore. According to preliminary data, among the stolen property was a collection of Scythian gold discovered by archaeologists in the 50s of the last century.
sources1103.title: CIV23470

sources1104.description:
Date of discovery: 13 June 2022
Province:  Zaporizhzhia Oblast 
City/Town/Village: Melitopol

33 Ukrainian drivers who were evacuating civilians from Mariupol and other cities are in Russian captivity, Ukrainska Pravda reported citing their family members. Russia reportedly accuses them of terrorism and wants to imprison them for 10-15 years. They have been held captive for nearly 2 months begining their captivity at a camp in this town and then driven to various prisons in Donetsk region by their Russian captors.
sources1104.title: CIV16624

sources1105.description:
Date of discovery: 13 July 2022

The Russian military is promoting its citizens from the poor regions of Russia – for example; Yakutia and Buryatiya, to settle on occupied Ukrainian territory such as Melitopol, Berdyansk, and Energodar. 

The “settlers” (illegal settlers) move into the apartments of the Ukrainian citizens in this cities who have abandoned their properties in the wake of the Russian invasion in order to escape towards Ukrainian controlled territory. Potentially violating article 33 of the Geneva convention on the Protection of the Civilian Population in Time of War. Reported by Human rights Ombudsman for  the Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada Lyudmila Denisova
sources1105.title: CIV86355

sources1106.description:
Date of discovery: 13 July 2022

The administration of the collaborators (ORDO) in Mariupol has received orders for the future mobilization plan for locals. According to this plan, it will commence in 15 September after the so called "referendum" on joining Russia. Reported by human rights Ombudwomen for the Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada Lyudmila Denisova
sources1106.title: CIV44559

sources1107.description:
Date of discovery: 12 July 2022

The Russian Military has been shelling crops in the Kherson, Zaporizhzhya, and Dnipropetrovsk regions, as a result of which hectares of grain crops have burned causing grain and wheat shortages for both the export and local market. As well as potentially leading to starvation of many people. Reported by human rights Ombudsman for the Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada Lyudmila Denisova.
sources1107.title: CIV75111

sources1108.description:
Date of discovery: 11 July 2022

"The Russian occupation administration of Ilovaisk, Donetsk region, has announced that the water supply in the city will be stopped. The lack of water puts the city's residents on the edge of survival. Such actions are another violation by the russian federation of the requirements of the 1949 Geneva Convention on the Protection of the Civilian Population in Time of War." . Reported by human rights Ombudsman for the Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada Lyudmila Denisova.
sources1108.title: CIV82598

sources1109.description:
Date of discovery: 09 July 2022

Russian occupation forces are organizing a two-stage referendum in the temporarily occupied Berdyansk on joining Russia. It is scheduled for September 11th. At the first stage of the so called referendum, "voting" at polling stations is planned. Furthermore, due to the possibility of lack of support of the local population,  a second stage for the referendum is envisaged which is bribery of locals apartment-by-apartment. 

"To do this, all heads of condominiums were forced to collect apartment-by-apartment lists of those willing to receive 10,000 rubles or humanitarian aid.  They will be included in the lists of those who voted - automatically. Thus, the second stage will provide an opportunity to falsify the vote, including at the expense of citizens who have left.  In addition, employees of captured public utilities and public sector institutions will automatically "vote", because their data was collected by the Russians in advance.

These actions of the Russian federation are a gross violation of the fundamental principles of sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, the requirements of Article 2 of the UN Charter and the Declaration on the Principles of International Law.". Reported by human rights Ombudsman for the Ukrainian Verkhovna Rada Lyudmila Denisova.
sources1109.title: CIV24192

sources1128.description:
Date of Discovery: 5 April 2022
In the village of Mala Rohan in the Kharkiv region, a russian militant beat and repeatedly raped a 31-year-old woman who was hiding at a school with her 5-year-old daughter, mother, sister, brother and other residents of the village. Holding a weapon near her head, the racist repeatedly sexually assaulted a woman who he said reminded him of the girl he went to school with. A russian militant cut the woman's neck and cheek with a knife, cut her hair, and hit her in the face with a book.  When the racists left, the woman and her family managed to walk to Kharkiv and receive the necessary medical care.
sources1128.title: CIV26589

sources1129.description:
Date of Discovery: 5 April 2022
In the Kharkiv region, the russian occupier raped a 29-year-old woman caring for her immobile mother for more than a week. The woman repeatedly experienced sexual violence on his part, but was unable to reach law enforcement.  Soon a militant broke her phone. A week later, the racist began to talk to the woman about love and offered to send her away from the war.  In response to the woman's refusal due to the inability to leave the mother, the villain simply shot the old woman in front of her daughter. The woman managed to escape and is now undergoing rehabilitation. Reported by Ombudsman Lyudmyla Denisova.
sources1129.title: CIV89207

sources1140.description:
Date of discovery: 26 March 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Mariupol

Kateryna, 19, was  sheltering in a basement in Mariupol when Chechen soldiers wearing black balaclavas came and asked to check documents, on March 26, just weeks after Russian forces entered the city. "They had rifles slung over their shoulders, she recalled, and they seemed drunk," she recalled. One of the soldiers told her she needed to come upstairs to be examined and then raped her, threatening to kill her if she resists.
sources1140.title: CIV71493

sources1141.description:
Date of discovery: 28 March 2022
Province: Donetsk Oblast
City/Town/Village: Mariupol

Nastya, 19, was hiding together with her sister and grandmother iin the basement of their house which was badly damaged by a bomb in March. On March 27 or 28, they got out to find clean clothes and encountered five Russian soldiers which pointed thei guns towards them and put garbage bags over their heads. Soldiers agreed to let Nastya's family members go, if she was "obedient". she was raped for several days by various men until a drugged or drunk Russian soldier took her outside to assault her. The soldier fell and Nastya ran away with her hands tied. She reached a random bulding where she fainted and was found by two women who took her to the hospital.
sources1141.title: CIV75571
